title: Nagpur Foodgrain Prices Open- September 23, 2019
text:
Nagpur Foodgrain Prices Open- September 23, 2019

Commodities 28 minutes ago (Sep 23, 2019 15:41)

Nagpur Foodgrain Prices Open- September 23, 2019 Nagpur Foodgrain Prices – APMC/Open Market-September 23, 2018 Nagpur, Sept 23 (Reuters) – Gram and tuar prices showed upward tendency in Nagpur Agriculture Produce and Marketing Committee (APMC) here on increased demand from local millers amid tight supply from producing belts. Notable rise on NCDEX in gram, upward trend in Madhya Pradesh pulses and reported demand from South-based millers also pushed up prices. About 300 bags of gram and 100 bags of tuar reported for auction, according to sources. FOODGRAINS & PULSES * Gram varieties ruled steady in open market here on poor demand from local traders. * Tuar varieties reported higher in open market here on renewed festival season demand from local traders. * Masoor varieties firmed up in open market here on good demand from local traders amid weak supply from producing regions. * In Akola, Tuar New – 5,500-5,700, Tuar dal (clean) – 8,100-8,200, Udid Mogar (clean) – 7,300-8,100, Moong Mogar (clean) 8,200-8,900, Gram – 4,300-4,400, Gram Super best – 5,600-6,000 * Wheat, rice and other foodgrain items moved in a narrow range in scattered deals and settled at last levels in thin trading activity.
